<Link id="l00256" /><CodeLine lineNumber="256"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00257" /><CodeLine lineNumber="257"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Null terminate the string for realpath. readlink never null</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00258" /><CodeLine lineNumber="258"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// terminates its output.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00259" /><CodeLine lineNumber="259"><Highlight kind="normal">    len = std::min(len, ssize&#95;t(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">sizeof</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">(exe&#95;path) - 1));</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00260" /><CodeLine lineNumber="260"><Highlight kind="normal">    exe&#95;path&#91;len&#93; = </Highlight><Highlight kind="charliteral">&#39;\\0&#39;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00261" /><CodeLine lineNumber="261"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00262" /><CodeLine lineNumber="262"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// On Linux, /proc/self/exe always looks through symlinks. However, on</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00263" /><CodeLine lineNumber="263"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// GNU/Hurd, /proc/self/exe is a symlink to the path that was used to start</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00264" /><CodeLine lineNumber="264"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// the program, and not the eventual binary file. Therefore, call realpath</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00265" /><CodeLine lineNumber="265"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// so this behaves the same on all platforms.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00266" /><CodeLine lineNumber="266"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="preprocessor">#if &#95;POSIX&#95;VERSION &gt;= 200112 || defined(&#95;&#95;GLIBC&#95;&#95;)</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00267" /><CodeLine lineNumber="267"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (</Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">char</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &#42;<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/sys/fs/#a2363fbfbd0a348f5d81fc3d3223ecae3">real&#95;path</a> = realpath(exe&#95;path, </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">nullptr</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">)) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00268" /><CodeLine lineNumber="268"><Highlight kind="normal">      std::string ret = std::string(<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/sys/fs/#a2363fbfbd0a348f5d81fc3d3223ecae3">real&#95;path</a>);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00269" /><CodeLine lineNumber="269"><Highlight kind="normal">      free(<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/sys/fs/#a2363fbfbd0a348f5d81fc3d3223ecae3">real&#95;path</a>);</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00459" /><CodeLine lineNumber="459"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// only be involved in the creation and deletion of regular files.  This</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00912" /><CodeLine lineNumber="912"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">static</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> file&#95;type direntType(dirent &#42;Entry) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00913" /><CodeLine lineNumber="913"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Most platforms provide the file type in the dirent: Linux/BSD/Mac.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00914" /><CodeLine lineNumber="914"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// The DTTOIF macro lets us reuse our status -&gt; type conversion.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00915" /><CodeLine lineNumber="915"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Note that while glibc provides a macro to see if this is supported,</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00916" /><CodeLine lineNumber="916"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// &#95;DIRENT&#95;HAVE&#95;D&#95;TYPE, it&#39;s not defined on BSD/Mac, so we test for the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00917" /><CodeLine lineNumber="917"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// d&#95;type-to-mode&#95;t conversion macro instead.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00918" /><CodeLine lineNumber="918"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="preprocessor">#if defined(DTTOIF)</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00919" /><CodeLine lineNumber="919"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> typeForMode(DTTOIF(<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/coff/#ae7629a0652411dc2be61aea4fee2b39caadd024eaaab0666500593f30456bbc43">Entry</a>-&gt;d&#95;type));</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00920" /><CodeLine lineNumber="920"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="preprocessor">#else</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00921" /><CodeLine lineNumber="921"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Other platforms such as Solaris require a stat() to get the type.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00922" /><CodeLine lineNumber="922"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> file&#95;type::type&#95;unknown;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00923" /><CodeLine lineNumber="923"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="preprocessor">#endif</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01031" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1031"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">/&#42; Reason about auto-conversion and file tags. Setting the file tag only</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01032" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1032"><Highlight kind="comment">   &#42; applies if file is opened in write mode:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01033" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1033"><Highlight kind="comment">   &#42;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01034" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1034"><Highlight kind="comment">   &#42; Text file:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01035" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1035"><Highlight kind="comment">   &#42;                  File exists       File created</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01036" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1036"><Highlight kind="comment">   &#42; CD&#95;CreateNew     n/a               conv: on</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01037" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1037"><Highlight kind="comment">   &#42;                                    tag: set 1047</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01038" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1038"><Highlight kind="comment">   &#42; CD&#95;CreateAlways  conv: auto        conv: on</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01039" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1039"><Highlight kind="comment">   &#42;                  tag: auto 1047    tag: set 1047</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01040" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1040"><Highlight kind="comment">   &#42; CD&#95;OpenAlways    conv: auto        conv: on</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01041" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1041"><Highlight kind="comment">   &#42;                  tag: auto 1047    tag: set 1047</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01042" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1042"><Highlight kind="comment">   &#42; CD&#95;OpenExisting  conv: auto        n/a</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01043" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1043"><Highlight kind="comment">   &#42;                  tag: unchanged</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01044" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1044"><Highlight kind="comment">   &#42;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01045" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1045"><Highlight kind="comment">   &#42; Binary file:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01046" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1046"><Highlight kind="comment">   &#42;                  File exists       File created</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01047" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1047"><Highlight kind="comment">   &#42; CD&#95;CreateNew     n/a               conv: off</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01048" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1048"><Highlight kind="comment">   &#42;                                    tag: set binary</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01049" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1049"><Highlight kind="comment">   &#42; CD&#95;CreateAlways  conv: off         conv: off</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01050" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1050"><Highlight kind="comment">   &#42;                  tag: auto binary  tag: set binary</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01051" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1051"><Highlight kind="comment">   &#42; CD&#95;OpenAlways    conv: off         conv: off</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01052" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1052"><Highlight kind="comment">   &#42;                  tag: auto binary  tag: set binary</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01053" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1053"><Highlight kind="comment">   &#42; CD&#95;OpenExisting  conv: off         n/a</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01054" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1054"><Highlight kind="comment">   &#42;                  tag: unchanged</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01055" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1055"><Highlight kind="comment">   &#42;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01056" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1056"><Highlight kind="comment">   &#42; Actions:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01057" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1057"><Highlight kind="comment">   &#42;   conv: off        -&gt; auto-conversion is turned off</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01058" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1058"><Highlight kind="comment">   &#42;   conv: on         -&gt; auto-conversion is turned on</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01059" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1059"><Highlight kind="comment">   &#42;   conv: auto       -&gt; auto-conversion is turned on if the file is untagged</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01060" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1060"><Highlight kind="comment">   &#42;   tag: set 1047    -&gt; set the file tag to text encoded in 1047</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01061" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1061"><Highlight kind="comment">   &#42;   tag: set binary  -&gt; set the file tag to binary</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01062" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1062"><Highlight kind="comment">   &#42;   tag: auto 1047   -&gt; set file tag to 1047 if not set</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01063" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1063"><Highlight kind="comment">   &#42;   tag: auto binary -&gt; set file tag to binary if not set</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01064" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1064"><Highlight kind="comment">   &#42;   tag: unchanged   -&gt; do not care about the file tag</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01065" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1065"><Highlight kind="comment">   &#42;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01066" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1066"><Highlight kind="comment">   &#42; It is not possible to distinguish between the cases &quot;file exists&quot; and</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01067" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1067"><Highlight kind="comment">   &#42; &quot;file created&quot;. In the latter case, the file tag is not set and the file</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01068" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1068"><Highlight kind="comment">   &#42; size is zero. The decision table boils down to:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01069" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1069"><Highlight kind="comment">   &#42;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01070" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1070"><Highlight kind="comment">   &#42; the file tag is set if</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01071" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1071"><Highlight kind="comment">   &#42;   - the file is opened for writing</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01072" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1072"><Highlight kind="comment">   &#42;   - the create disposition is not equal to CD&#95;OpenExisting</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01073" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1073"><Highlight kind="comment">   &#42;   - the file tag is not set</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01074" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1074"><Highlight kind="comment">   &#42;   - the file size is zero</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01075" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1075"><Highlight kind="comment">   &#42;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01076" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1076"><Highlight kind="comment">   &#42; This only applies if the file is a regular file. E.g. enabling</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01077" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1077"><Highlight kind="comment">   &#42; auto-conversion for reading from /dev/null results in error EINVAL when</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01078" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1078"><Highlight kind="comment">   &#42; calling read().</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01079" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1079"><Highlight kind="comment">   &#42;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01080" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1080"><Highlight kind="comment">   &#42; Using append mode with z/OS UTF-8 auto-conversion results in EINVAL when</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01081" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1081"><Highlight kind="comment">   &#42; calling write(). Instead we need to use lseek() to set offset to EOF after</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01082" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1082"><Highlight kind="comment">   &#42; open().</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01083" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1083"><Highlight kind="comment">   &#42;/</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01084" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1084"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> ((Flags &amp; OF&#95;Append) &amp;&amp; lseek(ResultFD, 0, SEEK&#95;END) == -1)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01085" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1085"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#ae075c94db10b09d6d5876d32219eaf0d">errnoAsErrorCode</a>();</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01086" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1086"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">struct </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">stat Stat;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01087" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1087"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (fstat(ResultFD, &amp;Stat) == -1)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01088" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1088"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#ae075c94db10b09d6d5876d32219eaf0d">errnoAsErrorCode</a>();</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01089" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1089"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (S&#95;ISREG(Stat.st&#95;mode)) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01090" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1090"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> DoSetTag = (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/directx/dxilresourceaccess-cpp/#adb4fa2b9065093d32736f78ea43a8c8a">Access</a> &amp; <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/sys/fs/#a5be5c24e530c666de488a0ed47e086efac6140a2ec08f1a1b4ae30ba3cbacb655">FA&#95;Write</a>) &amp;&amp; (Disp != CD&#95;OpenExisting) &amp;&amp;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01091" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1091"><Highlight kind="normal">                    !Stat.st&#95;tag.ft&#95;txtflag &amp;&amp; !Stat.st&#95;tag.ft&#95;ccsid &amp;&amp;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01092" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1092"><Highlight kind="normal">                    Stat.st&#95;size == 0;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01093" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1093"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (Flags &amp; OF&#95;Text) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01094" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1094"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">auto</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> EC = llvm::enablezOSAutoConversion(ResultFD))</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01099" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1099"><Highlight kind="normal">      &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01100" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1100"><Highlight kind="normal">    &#125; </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">else</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01140" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1140"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">char</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> Buffer&#91;<a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/textapi/utils-h/#ae688d728e1acdfe5988c7db45d6f0166">PATH&#95;MAX</a>&#93;;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01481" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1481"><Highlight kind="comment">/// This implementation tries to perform an APFS CoW clone of the file,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01482" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1482"><Highlight kind="comment">/// which can be much faster and uses less space.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01483" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1483"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Unfortunately fcopyfile(3) does not support COPYFILE&#95;CLONE, so the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01484" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1484"><Highlight kind="comment">/// file descriptor variant of this function still uses the default</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01486" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1486"><Highlight kind="normal">std::error&#95;code <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/sys/fs/#abe768b38d21bfc2bc91a1c1d09cd84de">copy&#95;file</a>(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> Twine &amp;From, </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> Twine &amp;To) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01487" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1487"><Highlight kind="normal">  std::string FromS = From.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/twine/#a4c1c1093a7749409c70838678514cc7c">str</a>();</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01488" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1488"><Highlight kind="normal">  std::string ToS = To.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/twine/#a4c1c1093a7749409c70838678514cc7c">str</a>();</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01489" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1489"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="preprocessor">#if &#95;&#95;has&#95;builtin(&#95;&#95;builtin&#95;available)</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01491" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1491"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Optimistically try to use clonefile() and handle errors, rather than</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01492" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1492"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// calling stat() to see if it&#39;ll work.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01493" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1493"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01494" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1494"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Note: It&#39;s okay if From is a symlink. In contrast to the behaviour of</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01495" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1495"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// copyfile() with COPYFILE&#95;CLONE, clonefile() clones targets (not the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01496" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1496"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// symlink itself) unless the flag CLONE&#95;NOFOLLOW is passed.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01497" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1497"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (!clonefile(FromS.c&#95;str(), ToS.c&#95;str(), 0))</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01498" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1498"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> std::error&#95;code();</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01499" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1499"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01500" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1500"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">auto</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> Errno = errno;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01501" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1501"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">switch</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (Errno) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01502" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1502"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">case</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> EEXIST:  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// To already exists.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01503" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1503"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">case</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> ENOTSUP: </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Device does not support cloning.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01504" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1504"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">case</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> EXDEV:   </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// From and To are on different devices.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01505" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1505"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">break</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01506" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1506"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">default</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01507" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1507"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Anything else will also break copyfile().</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01508" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1508"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> std::error&#95;code(Errno, std::generic&#95;category());</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01509" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1509"><Highlight kind="normal">    &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01510" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1510"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01511" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1511"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// TODO: For EEXIST, profile calling fs::generateUniqueName() and</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01512" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1512"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// clonefile() in a retry loop (then rename() on success) before falling</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01513" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1513"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// back to copyfile(). Depending on the size of the file this could be</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01514" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1514"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// cheaper.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01515" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1515"><Highlight kind="normal">  &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01516" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1516"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="preprocessor">#endif</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01517" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1517"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (!copyfile(FromS.c&#95;str(), ToS.c&#95;str(), </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">/&#42;State=&#42;/</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">NULL, COPYFILE&#95;DATA))</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01518" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1518"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> std::error&#95;code();</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01519" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1519"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#ae075c94db10b09d6d5876d32219eaf0d">errnoAsErrorCode</a>();</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01520" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1520"><Highlight kind="normal">&#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
